definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume

sentences.english: There are new spin-off products aimed at older girls and women, such as sun screen and cosmetics.
sentences.chinese: 该集团还推出了太阳镜和化妆品等新的副产品。

sentences.english: After, at together while just wanting to elected up a cosmetics to make up for farmland dream Jean Jean.
sentences.chinese: 之后，在齐珍珍刚要拿起化妆品帮田梦化妆的时候。

sentences.english: After, at together while just wanting to elected up a cosmetics to make up for farmland dream Jean Jean.
sentences.chinese: 之后，在齐珍珍刚要拿起化妆品帮田梦化妆的时候。

sentences.english: What is caused by the use of cosmetics after pigmentation?
sentences.chinese: 是什么原因引起化妆品使用后出现色素沉着呢？

sentences.english: Be gentle when washing your face and hair or using cosmetics.
sentences.chinese: 洗脸，梳头和用化妆品时，行动要柔柔等。

sentences.english: Dirt, bacteria, and makeup left on overnight can irritate skin, clog pores, and trigger breakouts.
sentences.chinese: 超过一夜的灰尘，细菌和化妆刺激皮肤，堵塞毛孔。

sentences.english: We offer fully refined oil for cosmetic application which is pale yellow in colour and is almost odourless .
sentences.chinese: 我们为化妆品生产商提供纯精制的榛子油。

sentences.english: E. g. People dress up in costumes for Hallowmas.
sentences.chinese: 人们在万圣节会化妆成不同的人物。

sentences.english: Main compartment holds your wallet, small cosmetic case and personal technology.
sentences.chinese: 主隔间认为你的钱包，小化妆盒，个人技术。

sentences.english: This little boy has put on makeup for a folk dance.
sentences.chinese: 这个小男孩为一场民族舞而化妆。

sentences.english: Sweat pants, hair tied, chillin with no makeup on.
sentences.chinese: 长运动裤，发带，不化妆的放松。

sentences.english: Disasters may come straight to you , but happiness often comes in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 灾难可能是径直走到面前，可是幸福总是化妆潜来。

sentences.english: It is the first domestic enterprise manufacturing top-grade fog-proof dressing mirrors cabinet .
sentences.chinese: 是国内首家生产高档防雾化妆镜柜企业。

sentences.english: Also it's very lightweight and you can use make-up on it.
sentences.chinese: 而且它非常的轻爽，使用后还可以化妆。

sentences.english: Draw a heart on her makeup mirror.
sentences.chinese: 在她的化妆镜上画颗爱心。

sentences.english: Do you use cosmetics or hair colorings?
sentences.chinese: 你有使用化妆品或染发剂吗？

definition: (of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup

lit. to present oneself confidently to the emperor, without makeup (as did the sister of Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]) (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) to show one's natural features, without makeup/to present oneself just as one is, without artifice
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
